description: Intensive study of musical masterworks from ca.1890 to the present, focusing on formal and stylistic
trends as well as the political, philosophical and economic contexts of Western art and popular
music from French impressionism through American hip hop. Course work includes
bibliographic instruction, lecture/discussion, and an analytic research paper. Prerequisites:
MUSIC 241 and MUSIC 242.  Offered fall semester 2014-15 and alternate years.
